Transforming Learning, Empowering Learners: The International Conference of the Learning Sciences (ICLS) 2016, Volume 2. Singapore: International Society of the Learning Sciences, pp. 35-43. https://doi.dx.org/10.22318/icls2016.103 Understanding students' epistemic views is critical for us educators to understand how they work with ideas and knowledge. The present study explored how college students’ online collaborative inquiry activities may inform their epistemic views. A mixed-method analysis revealed that students’ online knowledge-building and inquiry activities were associated with the change of their epistemic views. When engaging in more productive group inquiry activities, a more sophisticated epistemic view conducive to continual idea improvement for knowledge advancement was more likely to develop among students. en Singapore: International Society of the Learning Sciences Fostering More Informed Epistemic Views Among Students Through Knowledge Building Book chapter <dc:subject xml:lang="en">knowledge building</dc:subject> <dc:subject xml:lang="en">epistemic view</dc:subject> <dc:subject xml:lang="en">CSCL</dc:subject> <dc:subject xml:lang="en">knowledge creation</dc:subject>
